chargeHist.descr: Misuse of GPS Device - place without consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Misuse of GPS Device - place without consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Jay Peterson Sr.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
11:23 AM Defendant Eric Jay Peterson Sr. in court.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Eric Jay Peterson Sr.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice
Arraignment scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: no contact with EMR or their residence.  No use or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia.

1:57 PM Defendant Eric Jay Peterson Sr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Reid appears in court with defendant. Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Reid receives complaint, waives reading, pleads not guilty, asks for preliminary hearing. Court accepts pleas.
State requests $1000 cash, conditions of no contact with EMR or residence, no drugs. Cites prior convictions. 
Attorney Reid verifies address. Lifelong Douglas County resident. Asks for signature bond or lower cash of $100 to $200. 
Court makes statements regarding serious charges. Court orders $1000 cash, no contact with EMR or their residence.  No use or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.
